description:
This course deals with the theory of functions of a complex variable. The
topics to be covered are the Cauchy-Riemann equations and power
series, the properties of analytic and entire functions, such as the
maximum-modulus principle and the open mapping theorem, line and
contour integrals, the residue theorem, and conformal mappings. If time
permits, the analytic continuation as well as the gamma and zeta
functions will be also treated.
title: Complex Analysis
prerequisite:
YSC3206 One Real Variable or YSC3206 Introduction to Real Analysis OR
with the permission of the instructor
